question_stem:
Consider the following two numpy arrays:
import numpy as np
x = np.array([[1],
              [0],
              [-2]])
y = np.array([[0.3],
              [-0.9],
              [0.3]])
Use matmul and reshape to perform the matrix multiplication xTy x^T y 
The precise output array should be:
## array([-0.3])
 
Enter the Python code to obtain the above output:

items.part_stem_html:
Consider the following two numpy arrays:

import numpy as np
x = np.array([[1],
              [0],
              [-2]])
y = np.array([[0.3],
              [-0.9],
              [0.3]])

Use matmul and reshape to perform the matrix multiplication xTy x^T y

The precise output array should be:

## array([-0.3])

 

Enter the Python code to obtain the above output:
items.solution:
The following command will yield the desired output:
np.matmul(x.reshape((1,3)), y).reshape((1,))

## array([-0.3])

## array([-0.3])
items.solution_html:
The following command will yield the desired output:

np.matmul(x.reshape((1,3)), y).reshape((1,))

## array([-0.3])
## array([-0.3])
